title: I.Sicily inscription 000133
support: A stele or cippus with a rounded upper edge, of a dark grey limestone. Intact on the left, and on the left lower edge and probably the upper left edge also; but broken/damaged on the right upper and lower parts. The face is partly flaked off the surface, and a natural flaw runs vertically across the face of the stone also.

layout.p: Five lines of Latin letters, seemingly centred on the stone.

handNote.lettering: Rather worn, partially v-cut letters with simple terminal serifs and triangular comma-shaped interpuncts.

provenanceFound._: First recorded by Romano, who saw it in 1824 outside the entrance to the 'collegio degli studi pubblici' in Termini Imerese, and had it transferred to the 'Casa del Civico Magistrato'.

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2023-07-05, in the store-room of the Museo Civico.

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J.Prag 05.07.2023

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions
museum.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
